cross-section

Simple stratified group sampling. Because of the different size of the schools the number of classes was taken into consideration. The number of schools were summarized and categorized by regional units and school types. At the first stage the basic population was stratified based on the distribution of schools by regional location. The rating numbers for the individual counties and Budapest were defined, considering the number of classes in the individual schools. Then within the individual regional units the schools were arranged by school types, then by the appropriate group-defining criteria (region and school type)a 13% random sample and a 2,6% (compared to the sample, a 20%-os) supplementary sample was selected from among the ranked classes.
